Toby H Ferguson wrote:

>Hmm- "jumping to the offending line of code" sounds valuable to me - 
>didn't know it could be done! Is this the default behaviour? 
>

I use Eclipse, which has JUnit integrated.  It pops an Eclipse version 
of the Swing UI in a window pane, which is then capable of navigating to 
source code.  Some other popular Java IDEs do something similar.

Oh, I have Ant tasks for testing too, but I use those for the automated 
builds.  When I'm writing code test-first, I live exclusively in the 
Eclipse environment.  It's the fastest way I know to go through the 
test-code cycle.  I give a lot of demos and folks are generally amazed 
at the immediate feedback effect.

(Yes, I still do use vi, but not when I'm doing test-driven development.)

Mike
